DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether push labor control woman result less birth-related injury less postpartum urinary incontinence ( UI ) .
DOC.brief_title: Promoting Effective Recovery From Labor Urinary Incontinence ( PERL )
DOC.detailed_description: Birth relate urinary incontinence ( UI ) predictor UI old woman . Ways protect continence mechanism delivery may diminish woman 's risk UI later life . We propose study functional anatomy pelvic floor relate UI woman first baby . We hypothesize non-directed , spontaneous push protective strategy decrease risk immediate long term UI . Longitudinal comparison pelvic floor characteristic take 35 week gestation 6 week , 6 month , 12 month postpartum . Study participant see first 20 week gestation documentation baseline level pelvic floor function , specifically voluntary involuntary muscle strength , urinary continence status , urethral support . They randomly assign non-directed , spontaneous ( experimental ) direct , sustain push ( control ) group . Alterations may occur urethral support birth describe non-invasive urethral ultrasound .
DOC.criteria: Women give birth first time : 1 . Age 18 year old 2 . Less 20 week gestation 3 . Expected vaginal birth without use epidural analgesia 4 . Plan reside Southeast Michigan one year follow birth infant . 1 . History genitourinary neuromuscular pathology 2 . Previous pregnancy carry beyond 20 week gestation .
